channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Colorado Gender Ideology Wages War on Religious Freedom
item.description: The Supreme Court has the opportunity to reaffirm that religious freedom is not conditional on ideological conformity.

item.title: Kaine defends Jay Jones amid AG candidate’s texts envisioning murder of top Republican: ‘Still a supporter’
item.description: Virginia Sen. Tim Kaine defends Jay Jones despite calling his texts about murdering Todd Gilbert "indefensible" in the attorney general race against J...

item.title: House committee withdraws James Comey subpoena for Jeffrey Epstein testimony
item.description: The House Oversight Committee has dropped its subpoena for former FBI Director James Comey in its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Meet John Ternus, the 50-year-old Apple executive and former swimming champ who’s rumored to succeed Tim Cook as CEO
item.description: Apple is in the midst of a major leadership shakeup, where many senior executives are reportedly set to depart.

item.title: Time to Spring Trump’s Tariff Trap
item.description: As a condition of ending the shutdown, Democrats should curb the president’s tariff powers.

item.title: Wisconsin Judge Orders State Election Regulator To Keep Noncitizens Off Voter Rolls
item.description: The leftist-led Wisconsin Elections Commission quickly appealed the ruling demanding it verify voters are U.S. citizens.

item.title: Trump is greenlighting an Alaska megamine—and taking a government stake in the company digging it up
item.description: While Trump has often said, “drill, baby, drill,” he also supports “mine, baby, mine,” Interior Secretary Doug Burgum said.

item.title: Congress Should Impeach The Judge Who Gave Would-Be Mass SCOTUS Assassin Just Eight Years
item.description: Judge Boardman may not be interested in deterring the next Nicholas Roske, but Congress has the power to deter the next Boardman.

item.title: The War Against Immigration Enforcement
item.description: Chicago residents have failed to do the one thing necessary to avoid National Guard deployment — let federal officers do their jobs.

item.title: Gun Control Zealots, Other Lefties Stand By ‘Two Bullets’ Jay Jones
item.description: Liberal hypocrites still back the Virginia AG candidate even after texts show him fantasizing about murdering GOP lawmaker.

item.title: The Saintly Mother Teresa
item.description: Seventy-five years ago today, Mother Teresa of Calcutta founded the Missionaries of Charity.

item.title: Anniversary of a Horror
item.description: Two years later, the Trump peace plan carries the promise of ending the conflict, disarming Hamas, and returning the remaining hostages.

item.title: Social media trend turns tragic in NYC as ‘subway surfing’ claims lives
item.description: Six people died surfing subway trains in the city last year, up from five in 2023.

item.title: Fifth Third Bancorp is buying Comerica for $10.9 billion in an all-stock deal that will create the 9th largest U.S. bank
item.description: The buyout will create the 9th largest U.S. bank with approximately $288 billion in assets, the companies said Monday.
